name: DC Comics - Green Lanterns Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: The first Green Lantern appeared in 'All American Comics' #16 in 1940.  What is his real name?
questions.explanation:
Alan Scott.

	Alan Scott, the Golden Age Green Lantern, would be a founding member of the Justice Society of America.

questions.text: The Golden Age Green Lantern's ring would not work on one specific material, what was it?
questions.explanation:
Wood.

	Alan Scott's run as the original Green Lantern would last from 1940 through 1951. It would be twelve years after that before he would see print again.

questions.text: In 1959, DC created an updated (Silver Age) Green Lantern, this one a fearless test pilot for Ferris Aircraft Company.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Hal Jordan.

	Hal would be selected to be a member of the Green Lantern Corps, a sort of interstellar law enforcement agency, each member protecting a sector of the universe.  Hal's sector is 2814 which includes planet Earth.

questions.text: In 1968, it is revealed that each Green Lantern has a back up in the case they are unable to perform their duties.  The back up for sector 2814 was a brash, egocentric red headed loudmouth.  What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Guy Gardner.

	After his initial appearance in 'Green Lantern' (vol.2) #59, it would be over ten years before he would operate as a Green Lantern again.  He would eventually be a long serving member of the Green Lantern Corps and the Justice League International.

questions.text: In 1971, a second back-up Green Lantern for sector 2814 was introduced.  This back-up was an architect in his daily life.  He would become DC Comic's first super powered African-American hero.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Jon Stewart.

	Jon Stewart would first appear in Green Lantern (vol.2) #87.  Like the previous back-up Lantern (Guy Gardner), Jon Stewart would go on to have a long career as sector 2814's primary Green Lantern, and serve as a member of the Justice League.

questions.text: One of the primary villains of the Green Lantern Corps is a former Green Lantern.  From sector 1417, this former Green Lantern obtained a yellow power ring to battle his former teammates.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Sinestro.

	Thaal Sinestro uses a yellow power ring, since yellow is the one color that the rings of the Green Lanterns has no effect on.

questions.text: Introduced in 1995, this younger and inexperienced hero would emerge as the sole Green Lantern.  He was a struggling freelance artist and would remain the primary Green Lantern into the mid-2000s. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Kyle Rayner.

	Kyle would prove to be extremely popular with readers.  He would also complete a stint of time using the code name Ion.

questions.text: In 2012 a new, masked Green Lantern enters the DC Universe.  This Lebanese American Muslim is introduced during the "New 52" relaunch.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Simon Baz.

	Simon Baz first appeared in "The New 52 Free Comic Book Day Special #1.  He would go on to be a member of the Justice League.

questions.text: Originally called Power Ring, this Green Lantern is of Mexican-American and Honduran-American descent.  Initially the ring is forced on her, and her acceptance of it comes later.  What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Jessica Cruz.

	Jessica along with Lantern Simon Baz, are left as the two lone Green Lanterns on Earth.  Their power batteries are joined into one and they function as a Lantern team in the Justice League.

questions.text: In the DC Universe, 1000 years in the future, two regular characters from the Legion of Super Heroes series would both become a Green Lantern.  Who are they?
questions.explanation:
Rond Vidar and Mon-El.

	Rond Vidar is an honorary Legion member that eventually becomes a Green Lantern.  He must leave Earth because of a ban on Green Lanterns.  He is eventually killed in action and Mon-El is given the ring and title of Green Lantern.
